009package com.weather.sdk.config;
010
011import com.weather.sdk.exception.ConfigurationException;
012import java.time.Duration;
013import java.util.Objects;
014
015/**
016 * Fluent builder for creating {@link SDKConfiguration} instances with validation.
017 *
018 * <p>This class provides a user-friendly, type-safe builder pattern for configuring SDK instances.
019 * It follows the builder pattern with method chaining and includes comprehensive validation to
020 * ensure configuration correctness before object creation.
021 *
022 * <p><strong>Thread Safety:</strong> This class is not thread-safe and should not be used
023 * concurrently by multiple threads. Each builder instance should be used by a single thread.
024 *
025 * <h2>Configuration Parameters</h2>
026 *
027 * <ul>
028 *   <li><strong>apiKey</strong>: OpenWeatherAPI key (required, validated)
029 *   <li><strong>mode</strong>: Operation mode ({@link SDKMode}, default: ON_DEMAND)
030 *   <li><strong>pollingInterval</strong>: Polling frequency (default: 5 minutes)
031 *   <li><strong>cacheSize</strong>: Cache size in cities (default: 10)
032 *   <li><strong>cacheTTL</strong>: Cache time-to-live (default: 10 minutes)
033 *   <li><strong>connectionTimeout</strong>: HTTP connection timeout (default: 5 seconds)
034 *   <li><strong>readTimeout</strong>: HTTP read timeout (default: 10 seconds)
035 * </ul>
036 *
037 * <h2>Validation Rules</h2>
038 *
039 * <ul>
040 *   <li>API key must not be null or empty after trimming whitespace
041 *   <li>Mode must not be null
042 *   <li>Polling interval must be positive (if mode is POLLING)
043 *   <li>Cache size must be positive (> 0)
044 *   <li>Cache TTL must be positive
045 *   <li>Connection timeout must be positive
046 *   <li>Read timeout must be positive
047 * </ul>
048 *
049 * <h2>Usage Examples</h2>
050 *
051 * <h3>Basic On-Demand Configuration</h3>
052 *
053 * <pre>
054 * SDKConfiguration config = new WeatherSDKBuilder()
055 *     .apiKey("your-api-key-here")
056 *     .mode(SDKMode.ON_DEMAND)
057 *     .build();
058 * </pre>
059 *
060 * <h3>Polling Mode with Custom Settings</h3>
061 *
062 * <pre>
063 * SDKConfiguration config = new WeatherSDKBuilder()
064 *     .apiKey("your-api-key-here")
065 *     .mode(SDKMode.POLLING)
066 *     .pollingInterval(Duration.ofMinutes(10))
067 *     .cacheSize(10)
068 *     .cacheTTL(Duration.ofMinutes(15))
069 *     .connectionTimeout(Duration.ofSeconds(10))
070 *     .readTimeout(Duration.ofSeconds(15))
071 *     .maxRetries(3)
072 *     .retryDelayMs(50L)
073 *     .build();
074 * </pre>
075 *
076 * <h3>Error Handling Example</h3>
077 *
078 * <pre>
079 * try {
080 *   SDKConfiguration config = new WeatherSDKBuilder()
081 *       .apiKey("invalid-or-empty-key")
082 *       .mode(SDKMode.POLLING)
083 *       .pollingInterval(Duration.ofSeconds(30)) // Too short
084 *       .build();
085 * } catch (ConfigurationException e) {
086 *   System.err.println("Configuration error: " + e.getMessage());
087 *   System.err.println("Suggested fix: " + e.getSuggestedFix());
088 * }
089 * </pre>
090 *
091 * @see SDKConfiguration
092 * @see SDKMode
093 * @see ConfigurationException
094 * @since 1.0.0
095 */
096// PMD suppressions for builder pattern complexity and style violations
097@SuppressWarnings({
098  "PMD.TooManyMethods",
099  "PMD.LongVariable",
100  "PMD.MethodArgumentCouldBeFinal",
101  "PMD.UnnecessaryConstructor",
102  "PMD.LawOfDemeter",
103  "PMD.AvoidUncheckedExceptionsInSignatures",
104  "PMD.CyclomaticComplexity",
105  "PMD.AvoidDeeplyNestedIfStmts",
106  "PMD.AvoidFieldNameMatchingMethodName",
107  "PMD.OnlyOneReturn"
108})
109public final class WeatherSDKBuilder {
110
111  /** API key - required, non-null, non-empty after trimming */
112  private String apiKey;
113
114  /** SDK operation mode - default: ON_DEMAND */
115  private SDKMode mode = SDKMode.ON_DEMAND;
116
117  /** Polling interval - default: 5 minutes */
118  private Duration pollingInterval = Duration.ofMinutes(5);
119
120  /** Cache size - default: 10 cities, must be positive */
121  private int cacheSize = 10;
122
123  /** Cache TTL - default: 10 minutes, must be positive */
124  private Duration cacheTTL = Duration.ofMinutes(10);
125
126  /** Connection timeout - default: 5 seconds, must be positive */
127  private Duration connectionTimeout = Duration.ofSeconds(5);
128
129  /** Read timeout - default: 10 seconds, must be positive */
130  private Duration readTimeout = Duration.ofSeconds(10);
131
132  /** Maximum number of retry attempts - default: 3, must be non-negative */
133  private int maxRetries = 3;
134
135  /** Delay between retry attempts in milliseconds - default: 50ms, must be positive */
136  private long retryDelayMs = 500L;
137
138  /** Minimum recommended polling interval in minutes. */
139  private static final int MIN_POLLING_INTERVAL_MINUTES = 1;
140
141  /**
142   * Constructs a new WeatherSDKBuilder with default configuration values.
143   *
144   * <p>Default values:
145   *
146   * <ul>
147   *   <li>Mode: {@link SDKMode#ON_DEMAND}
148   *   <li>Polling interval: 5 minutes
149   *   <li>Cache size: 10 cities
150   *   <li>Cache TTL: 10 minutes
151   *   <li>Connection timeout: 5 seconds
152   *   <li>Read timeout: 10 seconds
153   *   <li>Max retries: 3
154   *   <li>Retry delay: 500ms
155   * </ul>
156   */
157  public WeatherSDKBuilder() {
158    // Initialize with defaults
159  }
160
161  /**
162   * Sets the OpenWeatherAPI authentication key.
163   *
164   * <p>The API key is required for all SDK operations. It will be trimmed of leading and trailing
165   * whitespace during validation.
166   *
167   * @param apiKeyParam the OpenWeatherAPI authentication key (must not be null or empty)
168   * @return this builder for method chaining
169   * @throws ConfigurationException if apiKeyParam is null or empty after trimming
170   */
171  public WeatherSDKBuilder apiKey(String apiKeyParam) throws ConfigurationException {
172    if (apiKeyParam == null || apiKeyParam.isBlank()) {
173      throw new ConfigurationException("API key must not be null or empty");
174    }
175    this.apiKey = apiKeyParam.trim();
176    return this;
177  }
178
179  /**
180   * Sets the SDK operation mode.
181   *
182   * <p>The mode determines how the SDK fetches weather data:
183   *
184   * <ul>
185   *   <li><strong>ON_DEMAND</strong>: Weather data is fetched only when requested by the
186   *       application
187   *   <li><strong>POLLING</strong>: Weather data is automatically fetched at regular intervals in
188   *       the background
189   * </ul>
190   *
191   * @param modeParam the SDK operation mode (must not be null)
192   * @return this builder for method chaining
193   * @throws ConfigurationException if modeParam is null
194   */
195  public WeatherSDKBuilder mode(SDKMode modeParam) throws ConfigurationException {
196    if (modeParam == null) {
197      throw new ConfigurationException("SDK mode must not be null");
198    }
199    this.mode = modeParam;
200    return this;
201  }
202
203  /**
204   * Sets the polling interval for background weather data updates.
205   *
206   * <p>This setting is only used when the mode is {@link SDKMode#POLLING}. The SDK will
207   * automatically fetch weather data for cached cities at the specified interval.
208   *
209   * <p><strong>Recommended Values:</strong>
210   *
211   * <ul>
212   *   <li>Minimum: 1 minute (for high-frequency updates)
213   *   <li>Recommended: 5-10 minutes (balance between freshness and API usage)
214   *   <li>Maximum: 60 minutes (for low-frequency updates)
215   * </ul>
216   *
217   * @param interval the polling interval (must not be null or non-positive)
218   * @return this builder for method chaining
219   * @throws ConfigurationException if interval is null, negative, or zero
220   */
221  public WeatherSDKBuilder pollingInterval(Duration interval) throws ConfigurationException {
222    if (interval == null) {
223      throw new ConfigurationException("Polling interval must not be null");
224    }
225    if (interval.isNegative() || interval.isZero()) {
226      throw new ConfigurationException("Polling interval must be positive");
227    }
228    this.pollingInterval = interval;
229    return this;
230  }
231
232  /**
233   * Sets the maximum number of cities to cache.
234   *
235   * <p>The SDK maintains an in-memory cache of recently requested weather data. When the cache
236   * reaches this limit, it uses an LRU (Least Recently Used) eviction strategy to remove old
237   * entries.
238   *
239   * <p><strong>Considerations:</strong>
240   *
241   * <ul>
242   *   <li>Higher values provide better cache hit rates but consume more memory
243   *   <li>Lower values save memory but may result in more API calls
244   *   <li>Typical applications: 10-50 cities
245   * </ul>
246   *
247   * @param size the maximum number of cities to cache (must be positive)
248   * @return this builder for method chaining
249   * @throws ConfigurationException if size is not positive
250   */
251  public WeatherSDKBuilder cacheSize(int size) throws ConfigurationException {
252    if (size <= 0) {
253      throw new ConfigurationException("Cache size must be positive");
254    }
255    this.cacheSize = size;
256    return this;
257  }
258
259  /**
260   * Sets the time-to-live for cached weather data.
261   *
262   * <p>Cached weather data becomes stale after this duration and will trigger a fresh API call.
263   * This helps ensure weather data remains reasonably current while reducing API usage.
264   *
265   * <p><strong>Recommended Values:</strong>
266   *
267   * <ul>
268   *   <li>Short TTL (5-10 minutes): For time-sensitive applications
269   *   <li>Medium TTL (10-15 minutes): Balance between freshness and API usage
270   *   <li>Long TTL (15-30 minutes): For applications where weather doesn't change rapidly
271   * </ul>
272   *
273   * @param ttl the cache time-to-live (must not be null or non-positive)
274   * @return this builder for method chaining
275   * @throws ConfigurationException if ttl is null, negative, or zero
276   */
277  public WeatherSDKBuilder cacheTTL(Duration ttl) throws ConfigurationException {
278    if (ttl == null) {
279      throw new ConfigurationException("Cache TTL must not be null");
280    }
281    if (ttl.isNegative() || ttl.isZero()) {
282      throw new ConfigurationException("Cache TTL must be positive");
283    }
284    this.cacheTTL = ttl;
285    return this;
286  }
287
288  /**
289   * Sets the HTTP connection timeout.
290   *
291   * <p>This timeout controls how long the SDK will wait while establishing a connection to the
292   * OpenWeatherAPI servers. If the connection cannot be established within this time, a {@link
293   * com.weather.sdk.exception.NetworkException} will be thrown.
294   *
295   * <p><strong>Recommended Values:</strong>
296   *
297   * <ul>
298   *   <li>Fast networks: 3-5 seconds
299   *   <li>Average networks: 5-10 seconds
300   *   <li>Slow/unreliable networks: 10-15 seconds
301   * </ul>
302   *
303   * @param timeout the connection timeout (must not be null or non-positive)
304   * @return this builder for method chaining
305   * @throws ConfigurationException if timeout is null, negative, or zero
306   */
307  public WeatherSDKBuilder connectionTimeout(Duration timeout) throws ConfigurationException {
308    if (timeout == null) {
309      throw new ConfigurationException("Connection timeout must not be null");
310    }
311    if (timeout.isNegative() || timeout.isZero()) {
312      throw new ConfigurationException("Connection timeout must be positive");
313    }
314    this.connectionTimeout = timeout;
315    return this;
316  }
317
318  /**
319   * Sets the HTTP read timeout.
320   *
321   * <p>This timeout controls how long the SDK will wait for a response after sending a request to
322   * the OpenWeatherAPI. If the server doesn't respond within this time, a {@link
323   * com.weather.sdk.exception.NetworkException} will be thrown.
324   *
325   * <p><strong>Recommended Values:</strong>
326   *
327   * <ul>
328   *   <li>Fast networks: 5-10 seconds
329   *   <li>Average networks: 10-15 seconds
330   *   <li>Slow networks: 15-30 seconds
331   * </ul>
332   *
333   * @param timeout the read timeout (must not be null or non-positive)
334   * @return this builder for method chaining
335   * @throws ConfigurationException if timeout is null, negative, or zero
336   */
337  public WeatherSDKBuilder readTimeout(Duration timeout) throws ConfigurationException {
338    if (timeout == null) {
339      throw new ConfigurationException("Read timeout must not be null");
340    }
341    if (timeout.isNegative() || timeout.isZero()) {
342      throw new ConfigurationException("Read timeout must be positive");
343    }
344    this.readTimeout = timeout;
345    return this;
346  }
347
348  /**
349   * Sets the maximum number of retry attempts for API calls.
350   *
351   * <p>The SDK will retry failed API calls up to this number of times before giving up. This is
352   * useful for handling temporary network issues or server errors.
353   *
354   * <p><strong>Recommended Values:</strong>
355   *
356   * <ul>
357   *   <li>0: No retries (fail fast)
358   *   <li>1-3: Conservative retry policy (default: 3)
359   *   <li>4-5: Aggressive retry policy
360   * </ul>
361   *
362   * @param maxRetriesParam the maximum number of retry attempts (must be non-negative)
363   * @return this builder for method chaining
364   * @throws ConfigurationException if maxRetriesParam is negative
365   */
366  public WeatherSDKBuilder maxRetries(int maxRetriesParam) throws ConfigurationException {
367    if (maxRetriesParam < 0) {
368      throw new ConfigurationException("Max retries must be non-negative");
369    }
370    this.maxRetries = maxRetriesParam;
371    return this;
372  }
373
374  /**
375   * Sets the delay between retry attempts in milliseconds.
376   *
377   * <p>This delay is applied between retry attempts when API calls fail. A longer delay allows the
378   * server time to recover but increases the total request time.
379   *
380   * <p><strong>Recommended Values:</strong>
381   *
382   * <ul>
383   *   <li>100-500ms: For quick retries on transient errors
384   *   <li>500-1000ms: Balanced approach (default: 500ms)
385   *   <li>1000-5000ms: Conservative approach for sensitive environments
386   * </ul>
387   *
388   * @param retryDelayMsParam the delay between retry attempts in milliseconds (must be positive)
389   * @return this builder for method chaining
390   * @throws ConfigurationException if retryDelayMsParam is not positive
391   */
392  public WeatherSDKBuilder retryDelayMs(long retryDelayMsParam) throws ConfigurationException {
393    if (retryDelayMsParam <= 0) {
394      throw new ConfigurationException("Retry delay must be positive");
395    }
396    this.retryDelayMs = retryDelayMsParam;
397    return this;
398  }
399
400  /**
401   * Validates the current configuration and constructs a new {@link SDKConfiguration} object.
402   *
403   * <p>This method performs comprehensive validation of all configuration parameters and throws a
404   * {@link ConfigurationException} if any validation fails. The exception includes detailed
405   * information about what went wrong and suggested fixes.
406   *
407   * <h4>Validation Performed</h4>
408   *
409   * <ul>
410   *   <li>API key: Must not be null or empty after trimming
411   *   <li>Mode: Must not be null
412   *   <li>Polling interval: Must be positive (if mode is POLLING)
413   *   <li>Cache size: Must be positive
414   *   <li>Cache TTL: Must be positive
415   *   <li>Connection timeout: Must be positive
416   *   <li>Read timeout: Must be positive
417   * </ul>
418   *
419   * @return a new, validated SDKConfiguration object
420   * @throws ConfigurationException if any configuration parameter is invalid
421   */
422  public SDKConfiguration build() throws ConfigurationException {
423    validateApiKey();
424    validateMode();
425    validatePollingInterval();
426    validateCacheSize();
427    validateCacheTTL();
428    validateConnectionTimeout();
429    validateReadTimeout();
430    validateTimeoutsRelationship();
431    validateMaxRetries();
432    validateRetryDelay();
433
434    return new SDKConfiguration(
435        apiKey,
436        mode,
437        pollingInterval,
438        cacheSize,
439        cacheTTL,
440        new SDKConfiguration.TimeoutConfig(connectionTimeout, readTimeout),
441        maxRetries,
442        retryDelayMs);
443  }
444
445  /**
446   * Validates the API key.
447   *
448   * @throws ConfigurationException if the API key is invalid
449   */
450  private void validateApiKey() throws ConfigurationException {
451    if (apiKey == null || isBlank(apiKey)) {
452      throw new ConfigurationException("API key is required and must not be empty", "apiKey");
453    }
454  }
455
456  /**
457   * Checks if a string is blank (null, empty, or contains only whitespace).
458   *
459   * @param str the string to check
460   * @return true if the string is blank, false otherwise
461   */
462  private boolean isBlank(String str) {
463    if (str == null) {
464      return true;
465    }
466    for (int i = 0; i < str.length(); i++) {
467      if (!Character.isWhitespace(str.charAt(i))) {
468        return false;
469      }
470    }
471    return true;
472  }
473
474  /**
475   * Validates the SDK mode.
476   *
477   * @throws ConfigurationException if the mode is invalid
478   */
479  private void validateMode() throws ConfigurationException {
480    if (mode == null) {
481      throw new ConfigurationException("SDK mode is required", "mode");
482    }
483  }
484
485  /**
486   * Validates the polling interval based on the selected mode.
487   *
488   * @throws ConfigurationException if the polling interval is invalid
489   */
490  private void validatePollingInterval() throws ConfigurationException {
491    if (mode == SDKMode.POLLING) {
492      if (pollingInterval.isNegative() || pollingInterval.isZero()) {
493        throw new ConfigurationException(
494            "Polling interval must be positive for POLLING mode", "pollingInterval");
495      }
496
497      if (pollingInterval.toMinutes() < MIN_POLLING_INTERVAL_MINUTES) {
498        throw new ConfigurationException(
499            "Polling interval too short for POLLING mode", "pollingInterval");
500      }
501    }
502  }
503
504  /**
505   * Validates the cache size.
506   *
507   * @throws ConfigurationException if the cache size is invalid
508   */
509  private void validateCacheSize() throws ConfigurationException {
510    if (cacheSize <= 0) {
511      throw new ConfigurationException("Cache size must be positive", "cacheSize");
512    }
513  }
514
515  /**
516   * Validates the cache TTL.
517   *
518   * @throws ConfigurationException if the cache TTL is invalid
519   */
520  private void validateCacheTTL() throws ConfigurationException {
521    if (cacheTTL.isNegative() || cacheTTL.isZero()) {
522      throw new ConfigurationException("Cache TTL must be positive", "cacheTTL");
523    }
524  }
525
526  /**
527   * Validates the connection timeout.
528   *
529   * @throws ConfigurationException if the connection timeout is invalid
530   */
531  private void validateConnectionTimeout() throws ConfigurationException {
532    if (connectionTimeout.isNegative() || connectionTimeout.isZero()) {
533      throw new ConfigurationException("Connection timeout must be positive", "connectionTimeout");
534    }
535  }
536
537  /**
538   * Validates the read timeout.
539   *
540   * @throws ConfigurationException if the read timeout is invalid
541   */
542  private void validateReadTimeout() throws ConfigurationException {
543    if (readTimeout.isNegative() || readTimeout.isZero()) {
544      throw new ConfigurationException("Read timeout must be positive", "readTimeout");
545    }
546  }
547
548  /**
549   * Validates the relationship between connection and read timeouts.
550   *
551   * @throws ConfigurationException if the timeout relationship is invalid
552   */
553  private void validateTimeoutsRelationship() throws ConfigurationException {
554    if (readTimeout.compareTo(connectionTimeout) < 0) {
555      throw new ConfigurationException(
556          "Read timeout must be greater than or equal to connection timeout", "readTimeout");
557    }
558  }
559
560  /**
561   * Validates the maximum number of retries.
562   *
563   * @throws ConfigurationException if max retries is invalid
564   */
565  private void validateMaxRetries() throws ConfigurationException {
566    if (maxRetries < 0) {
567      throw new ConfigurationException("Max retries must be non-negative");
568    }
569  }
570
571  /**
572   * Validates the retry delay.
573   *
574   * @throws ConfigurationException if the retry delay is invalid
575   */
576  private void validateRetryDelay() throws ConfigurationException {
577    if (retryDelayMs <= 0) {
578      throw new ConfigurationException("Retry delay must be positive");
579    }
580  }
581
582  /**
583   * Returns a string representation of this builder's current state.
584   *
585   * <p>The string includes all configured values (including API key for debugging purposes).
586   *
587   * @return a string representation of this builder
588   */
589  @Override
590  public String toString() {
591    return "WeatherSDKBuilder{"
592        + "apiKey='"
593        + apiKey
594        + '\''
595        + ", mode="
596        + mode
597        + ", pollingInterval="
598        + pollingInterval
599        + ", cacheSize="
600        + cacheSize
601        + ", cacheTTL="
602        + cacheTTL
603        + ", connectionTimeout="
604        + connectionTimeout
605        + ", readTimeout="
606        + readTimeout
607        + ", maxRetries="
608        + maxRetries
609        + ", retryDelayMs="
610        + retryDelayMs
611        + '}';
612  }
613
614  /**
615   * Compares this WeatherSDKBuilder to the specified object for equality.
616   *
617   * <p>Two WeatherSDKBuilder objects are considered equal if they have identical configuration
618   * values.
619   *
620   * @param obj the object to compare with
621   * @return true if the objects are equal, false otherwise
622   */
623  @Override
624  @SuppressWarnings({"PMD.LocalVariableCouldBeFinal", "PMD.OnlyOneReturn"})
625  public boolean equals(Object obj) {
626    if (this == obj) {
627      return true;
628    }
629    if (obj == null || getClass() != obj.getClass()) {
630      return false;
631    }
632    WeatherSDKBuilder that = (WeatherSDKBuilder) obj;
633    return cacheSize == that.cacheSize
634        && maxRetries == that.maxRetries
635        && retryDelayMs == that.retryDelayMs
636        && Objects.equals(apiKey, that.apiKey)
637        && mode == that.mode
638        && Objects.equals(pollingInterval, that.pollingInterval)
639        && Objects.equals(cacheTTL, that.cacheTTL)
640        && Objects.equals(connectionTimeout, that.connectionTimeout)
641        && Objects.equals(readTimeout, that.readTimeout);
642  }
643
644  /**
645   * Returns a hash code value for this WeatherSDKBuilder.
646   *
647   * @return a hash code value for this object
648   */
649  @Override
650  public int hashCode() {
651    return Objects.hash(
652        apiKey,
653        mode,
654        pollingInterval,
655        cacheSize,
656        cacheTTL,
657        connectionTimeout,
658        readTimeout,
659        maxRetries,
660        retryDelayMs);
661  }
662}
